These effects and tools exploit the Flash Player's new "Pixel Bender" technology to manipulate photos in ways not possible before. If you are comfortable with basic computer programming you can create your own effects using the Pixel Bender Toolkit. Click here to learn how.
New effects can be loaded straight into Picnik. When you've created something you want to share with millions of Picnikers please email it to us. We'll include the top contributions in future Picnik updates.

Making collages from your photos has never been easier.
1. Choose the basic collage type you want by clicking the thumbnails on the left. Don't worry, you can always change this.
2. Drag and drop photos from the Photo Basket below onto your collage, or click Auto-fill. Afterwards you can drag and drop photos within your collage to move or swap them.
3. Drag within a photo to adjust its crop.
4. Customize your collage by sliding the settings around.
All done? Hit Done! and you'll be able to add effects, frames, text and save your collage.

Showing off your photos has never been easier. Create a digital slideshow by gathering your photos into a Show and share it with the world!
Use the Upload button to browse your hard drive for images. Find the photos you want and select Upload to insert them directly into your Show.
Use the menus to see where your photos are on any of our third-party sites or your computer or History. Then drag the thumbnails into the workspace at right where you can reorder and set captions.

Hit Auto-fill and we'll automatically fill up your workspace with photos from the folder you have currently selected. We'll pick up to 10 for free users, and 100 for Premium Picnikers! You can still name and reorder them in the next step.
View all the photos you’ve placed in your Show here. Drag and drop the photos to insert elsewhere in the rotation, you can also click on them to add a Caption and view details!
Select a style to preview different varieties of Show. Don’t worry, you can change this later.

Change these settings to adjust the look of your Show. Choose from various photo Transition Types. Set the Background Color to coordinate with your photos. If you’ll be using the Film Strip style, choose a Highlight Color to feature the image being viewed which shows thumbnails of your photos as they go by. Don’t forget to adjust the Speed, in seconds, for a longer, more leisurely Show, or a snappier one.

Use the Show Title box to let your viewers know what they’re watching. Anything from “Photographic Evidence of Perpetual Motion” to “Suzie’s Bachelorette Party!” will kick off your Show in style and in context.

Great! Hit Save to preserve your updates and publish your show. Then hit Share to email a link to your Show under the Email this Show tab, and under the Embed this Show tab choose to send out your Show’s link for viewing or post to your blog by embedding it!
